questions.text: When someone cuts you off in traffic, your immediate internal reaction is:

options.text: Intense, potentially colorful, rage.
Annoyance, but you let it go quickly.
Analyze their driving for patterns of incompetence.
Note their license plate, just in case.

questions.text: Your friend asks for your honest opinion about their new haircut. It's terrible. You:

options.text: Tell them it looks great, no need to hurt their feelings.
Bluntly tell them it's awful and suggest a fix.
Say it's 'interesting' and change the subject.
Ask them what they think first, then mirror their opinion.

questions.text: You're at a party and notice someone you dislike. You:

options.text: Avoid them completely, even if it means leaving early.
Engage them in conversation to gather information.
Subtly sabotage their social interactions.
Make a scene to ensure everyone knows your feelings.

questions.text: When you're alone in a room, your thoughts tend to:

options.text: Race from one idea to the next, never settling.
Follow a structured pattern, like solving a puzzle.
Dwell on past interactions and future possibilities.
Question everyone's motives and intentions.

questions.text: When you make a mistake, your first thought is:

options.text: How can I blame this on someone else?
What can I learn from this?
This proves I'm fundamentally flawed.
How can I use this to my advantage later?

questions.text: Your internal monologue when waiting in line is:

options.text: Calculating the most efficient way to cut in line.
Fuming about the incompetence of the system.
Planning your next three moves in detail.
Wondering if everyone else is as bored as you are.

questions.text: When someone succeeds where you failed, you think:

options.text: They must have cheated or had unfair advantages.
How can I use their success to further my own goals?
Good for them, I'll try harder next time.
This is unacceptable, I need to do something about this.

questions.text: Your reaction to unexpected good news is:

options.text: Immediate suspicion about hidden motives.
Calculating how to maximize the benefit.
Uncontrollable excitement and celebration.
Cautious optimism while checking for catches.
